objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The author of the YARA rules provided in the report, as indicated in the 'meta' section of each rule. Likely the authoring organization of the report.

objects.name: Deleted temporary file
objects.description: This file is deleted by the Infinite Second installer script. Its purpose is unclear, possibly an artifact of a parent component.

objects.name: Executed and deleted script
objects.description: This file is executed and then deleted by Infinite Second. It is suggested to be a PowerShell script.

objects.name: Modified scheduled task file
objects.description: The XML file for the Microsoft Consolidator scheduled task, which is modified by Infinite Second for persistence.
objects.pattern: [file:name = 'Consolidator' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer Experience Improvement Program']

objects.name: Obfuscated payload storage
objects.description: Registry value used by Infinite Second to store the obfuscated PowerShell script payload.

objects.name: 3DES password storage
objects.description: Registry value used to store the password for 3DES decryption of the PowerSploit script.

objects.name: 3DES salt storage
objects.description: Registry value used to store the salt for 3DES decryption of the PowerSploit script.

objects.name: Consolidator executable path backup
objects.description: Registry value used to store the path to the Microsoft Consolidator executable.

objects.name: 3DES key material storage key
objects.description: Registry key used to store the password and salt for 3DES decryption of the PowerSploit script.

objects.name: Consolidator arguments backup
objects.description: Registry value used to store any configured arguments for the Microsoft Consolidator executable.

objects.name: Scheduled task backup
objects.description: Registry value used to store a backup of the Microsoft Consolidator scheduled task configuration.

objects.name: Infinite Second registry storage key
objects.description: Parent registry key used by Infinite Second to store its configuration and payloads.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the main PowerShell dropper script for ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the main PowerShell dropper script for ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the main PowerShell dropper script for ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Base64 encoded script from registry (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Base64 encoded version of a script stored in the registry by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for Base64 encoded script from registry (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Base64 encoded version of a script stored in the registry by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for Base64 encoded script from registry (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Base64 encoded version of a script stored in the registry by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for Decoded script from registry (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the decoded version of a script stored in the registry by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for Decoded script from registry (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the decoded version of a script stored in the registry by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for Decoded script from registry (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the decoded version of a script stored in the registry by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit script (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the modified version of the PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection PowerShell script.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit script (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the modified version of the PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection PowerShell script.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit script (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the modified version of the PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection PowerShell script.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x86) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x86) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x86) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x64) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x64) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x64) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: infinite second
objects.description: A malicious PowerShell script that acts as a dropper for the ComRAT malware. It utilizes multiple layers of obfuscation, including XOR, 3DES, Base64, and GZIP. It achieves persistence by modifying the Microsoft Consolidator scheduled task to execute upon user log-in and every 6 hours. It stores its configuration and payloads within the Windows registry.

objects.name: comrat
objects.description: A malware payload (Windows DLL for x86 and x64) dropped and executed by the Infinite Second script. It is injected into the explorer.exe process using a modified PowerSploit script. The report notes it is well-documented in open source but does not detail its specific functionality.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: PowerShell
objects.description: Infinite Second is a PowerShell script that deploys and set ups up persistence for ComRAT.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Infinite Second creates or modifies a scheduled task to run as SYSTEM to launch ComRAT.

objects.name: Modify Registry
objects.description: Infinite Second stores cryptographic keys, additional scripts and obfuscated payloads in the registry.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Infinite Second deobfuscates information stored in the registry using 3DES, XOR, and Base64 encoding.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: Infinite Second uses registry values that masquerade as legitimate software.

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: Infinite Second deletes C:\Windows\Temp\tmp4071.tmp and C:\Users\Public\Documents\thumbs.ini

objects.name: infinitesecond_custom_xor
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_custom_xor
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the XOR implementation"

    strings:
      $a = "KGJ5dGVbXSBpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXMsIGJ5dGVbXSBnYW1tYSl7Ynl0ZVtdIG91dHB1dCA9IG5l
dyBieXRlW2luY29tZV9ieXRlcy5MZW5ndGhdO2ZvciAoaW50IGkgPSAwOyBpIDwgaW5jb21lX
2J5dGVzLkxlbmd0aDsgKytpKXtvdXRwdXRbaV0gPSAoYnl0ZSkoaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzW2ldIF
4gZ2FtbWFbaSAlIGdhbW1hLkxlbmd0aF0pO31yZXR1cm4gb3V0cHV0O319"

$b = "hieXRlW10gaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzLCBieXRlW10gZ2FtbWEpe2J5dGVbXSBvdXRwdXQgPSBuZX
dgIEJ5dGVbaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzLkxlbmd0aF07Zm9yIChpbnQgaSA9IDA7IGkgPCBpbmNvbWVf
Ynl0ZXMuTGVuZ3RoOyArK2kpe291dHB1dFtpXSA9IChieXRlKShpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXNbaV0gXg
IGdhbW1hW2kgJSBnYW1tYS5MZW5ndGhdKTt9cmV0dXJuIG91dHB1dDt9f"

$c = "oYnl0ZVtdIGluY29tZV9ieXRlcywgYnl0ZVtdIGdhbW1hKXtieXRlW10gb3V0cHV0ID0gbmV
3IGJ5dGVbaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzLkxlbmd0aF07Zm9yIChpbnQgaSA9IDA7IGkgPCBpbmNvbWVf
Ynl0ZXMuTGVuZ3RoOyArK2kpe291dHB1dFtpXSA9IChieXRlKShpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXNbaV0gX
iBnYW1tYVtpICUgZ2FtbWEuTGVuZ3RoXSk7fXJldHVybiBvdXRwdXQ7fX"
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_random_name_function
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_random_name_function
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the random name generator"

    strings:
        $ = "function TVM730egf([string[]]$GP50afa) { $UC33gfa = ((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-Random -Min 0x41 -Max 0x5B)}) -join '');"
        $ = "$EQ33abh = ((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-Random -Min 0x30 -Max 0x3A)}) -join '');"
        $ = "$OFK689fa = ((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-Random -Min 0x61 -Max 0x6B)}) -join '');"
    condition: any of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_hardcoded_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_hardcoded_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies hardcoded strings throughout the script"

    strings:
        $ = "HKLM:\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\SQMClient\\Windows"
        $ = "\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\WINEVT\\Publishers\\{cabe18a5-69b9-4eec-bed0-fa080ed05a3b}\\ChannelReferences\\0"
        $ = "C:\\Windows\\Temp\\tmp4071.tmp"
        $ = "C:\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer Experience Improvement Program\\Consolidator"
        $ = "Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer Experience Improvement Program"
        $ = "WSqmConHex"
        $ = "WSqmConBin"
        $ = "WSqmCons"
        $ = "WSqmConBak"

    condition: 4 of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_3des_file
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_3des_file
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "3DES Initialisation Vector"

    strings:

$IV = "FVADRCORAOSKBHPX"

    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_psbreakpoint_luis_armstrong
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_psbreakpoint_luis_armstrong
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identification of unusual PowerShell break point"

    strings:
        $  = "Set-PSBreakpoint -Variable luis_armstrong -Mode Write;" wide ascii
    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_powershell_reflective_injection
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Infinite Second
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. infinite second.
